responsibilities: Lead the modernization of IHS health records by establishing a central repository for clinical data and longitudinal patient records.
Design and implement Azure data pipelines to consolidate clinical data from 200+ healthcare facilities into an enterprise analytics environment.
Develop automated ETL processes for high-volume JSON/HL7 FHIR data using Azure Data Factory and Data Lake.
Create and optimize PySpark processes for large-scale healthcare data transformation.
Build and maintain enterprise data models to standardize clinical information across facilities.
Implement monitoring solutions to ensure data quality and pipeline performance.
Provide technical leadership on cloud architecture best practices.
skills: Strong programming skills in Python (PySpark) and .NET for large-scale data processing.
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL) and data modeling for enterprise-scale databases.
Extensive experience with Azure data services including Azure Data Lake Gen2, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Azure Monitor, and Spark Clusters.
Experience developing Infrastructure as Code and RESTful APIs in Azure.
Track record of implementing CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Advanced PowerBI data visualization and development skills.
Experience with HL7 FHIR implementation and healthcare data standards.
Experience with Agile methodologies and team leadership.
qualifications: Technical Training, Certification(s) or Degree and 1+ years of experience or equivalent years of experience.
Ability to take the lead as a big data engineer on a database migration and data pipelines using Azure.
Must be able to obtain a public trust level 5 clearance, which requires residency in the U.S. for 3 of the last 5 years.
Relevant Azure certifications such as Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203), Azure Database Administrator Associate (DP-300), and Azure Solutions Architect Expert (AZ-305) are nice to have.
Master's degree in Computer Science or related field is nice to have.
